5. Privacy Policy and Personal Information Protection
5.1. Protecting your personal information is important to Mi Home. In order to provide software functionality and improve user experience, Mi Home will collect data as follows.
5.1.1. We may collect any or all of the personal information you provide to us, such as your name, phone number, e-mail address, Mi Account information (such as your security-related information, name, birthday, and gender), information or data that your access to the Mi Home platform synchronizes, the account and related settings created on the Mi Home platform, the device you added or messages you sent, feedback, and any other information you provide to us.
5.1.2. Information related to your handheld terminal or SIM card: Information related to running the Mi Home handheld terminal, for example, the IMEI number, IMSI number, system version, device manufacturer information, model name, and network operator.
5.1.3. Device information: Device information associated with your account, for example, MAC address, DID, and information collected by the corresponding device sensors (such as temperature, humidity, PM2.5, AQI, TDS, tVOC, CO2, ambient light, smoke concentration, natural gas concentration, power consumption, operating trajectory, signal strength, action/screen detection, body temperature, body weight, and on/off status), as well as the operating conditions of device consumables (such as the filter and filter service life).

5.1.5. Location information (specific services/features only): Various types of information related to your location, for example, country code, city code, mobile network code, cell ID, latitude and longitude information, and language settings.
5.1.6. Login information: Information related to your use of certain features and devices. Examples include cookies and other anonymous identifier technologies, IP addresses, temporary message history, and standard system logs.

We may also collect other types of anonymous information that are not associated with individuals. For example, it is possible to collect the device model and firmware version number of the device used to access Mi Home when using a particular service. The purpose of collecting such information is to improve the services we provide you with. 5.2. Mi Home will collect, use and protect your data in accordance with Mi Home’s Privacy Policy. You can view Mi Home’s Privacy Policy in the Mi Home app.

Mi Home User Agreement & Privacy Policy

"Our rivacy policy was updated on the 20th of October, 2017. We have revised our Privacy Policy, and from this date onwards this policy can provide details about how we manage the personal information you disclose when using any Mi Home products or services, with the exception of certain Mi Home products or services that provide their own independent Privacy Policy.
Please take some time to become familiar with our privacy practices, and please let us know if you have any questions.

Our promise to you
This Privacy Policy sets out how Xiaomi and its affiliates (hereafter Xiaomi or We) collect, use, disclose, process and protect the information you provide through the Mi Home app when using our products and services. If we ask you to provide certain information to verify your identity when using Mi Home products and services, we will use this information strictly in accordance with this policy and/or our user terms and conditions.

This policy is formulated with your needs in mind; it is important that you fully understand our personal data collection and usage practices and that you are ultimately in control of the personal information you provide.

In this Privacy Policy, personal information refers to the information itself or other information accessible to Xiaomi that allows us to identify the data of specific individuals. Such personal information includes your name, address, telephone number, and e-mail address.

By using Mi Home products and services, you acknowledge that you have read, acknowledged, and accepted all the terms set forth in this Privacy Policy, including any changes we may make at any time. We are committed to protecting the privacy, confidentiality and security of your personal information in accordance with applicable laws (including the data protection laws specific to your location). At the same time we promise our staff and agents will fulfill these obligations.

Finally, what we want is the best experience for our users. If you have any questions about the data processing practices outlined in this Privacy Policy, please contact our Data Protection Officer at privacy@xiaomi.com so that we can handle your special needs. We are happy to deal with your problem directly.

What information is collected and how is it used?

The types of information collected
We will ask you to provide the personal information necessary to provide you with our services. If you do not provide this personal information, we may not be able to provide you with our products or services.
We collect the following types of information (whether or not they are personal information):
• Information you provide or upload to us: We may collect any or all of the personal information you provide to us, such as your name, phone number, e-mail address, Mi Account information (such as your security-related information, name, birthday, or gender), information or data that your access to the Mi Home platform synchronizes, the account and related settings created on the Mi Home platform, the device you added or messages you sent, feedback, and any other information you provide to us.
• Information related to your handheld terminal or SIM card: Information related to running the Mi Home handheld terminal. For example, the IMEI number, IMSI number, system version, device manufacturer information, model name, and network operator.
• Device information: Device information associated with your account. For example, MAC address, DID, and information collected by the corresponding device sensors (such as temperature, humidity, PM2.5, AQI, TDS, tVOC, CO2, ambient light, smoke concentration, natural gas concentration, power consumption, operating trajectory, signal strength, action/screen detection, body temperature, body weight, and on/off status), as well as the operating conditions of device consumables (such as the filter, filter service life, etc.).
• Information we specify about you: We may collect and use information such as your Mi Account.
• Location information (specific services/features only): Various types of information related to your location. For example, country code, city code, mobile network code, cell ID, latitude and longitude information, and language settings.
• Login information: Information related to your use of certain features and devices. Examples include cookies and other anonymous identifier technologies, IP addresses, temporary message history, and standard system logs.
• Additional information: Environmental characteristic value or ECV (device-bound account (e-mail and phone number), connected Wi-Fi account and password, geo-location information, etc.)

We may also collect other types of anonymous information that are not associated with individuals. For example, it is possible to collect the device model and firmware version number of the device used to access Mi Home when using a particular service. The purpose of collecting such information is to improve the services we provide you. The type and amount of information collected depends on how you use, join, or participate in our products and/or services.

How this personal information will be used
The purpose of collecting personal information is to provide you with products and/or services and to ensure that we comply with applicable laws. You hereby agree that we process personal information for the purposes set forth in this Privacy Policy and disclose personal information to our affiliates (which cover communications, social media, technology and cloud businesses) and third-party service providers (as defined below).
We may use your personal information for the following purposes:
• Providing, processing, maintaining, improving, and developing the products and/or services we provide to you, as well as through devices or Mi Home-provided services.
• Communicating with you about your devices, services, or any general inquiries such as updates, device firmware/software upgrades, customer advisory support, related information, notifications, and more.
• Analyzing and developing statistical information related to the use of our products and services to better improve them.
• Store and maintain information about you for our business operations or legal obligations.
Here's more details on how we use your information, which may include personal information.
• Creating your account. The personal information collected when creating an account on a mobile device is used to create a user's personal account and profile page.
• Providing location-based services. We may use location information to provide you with the best possible user experience when using Mi Home and accessing Mi Home devices, such as analyzing and providing information about the surrounding weather, air quality, water quality, and launching the appropriate devices and experiences in advance according to your choices. You can turn this feature off at any time by entering device settings or stopping your use of this application. access.
• Device access. In order to access Mi Home, your device must connect to the network. Therefore, when adding devices to the Mi Home app, you need to enter the corresponding Wi-Fi name and password. This information is only used for the device distribution network. We will encrypt the Wi-Fi and password data you input and store it in your mobile terminal; we will not upload it to the server, you can enter the device to delete the information at any time.
• Device status display. Status information (such as temperature, humidity, PM2.5, AQI, TDS, tVOC, CO2, ambient light, smoke concentration, natural gas concentration, power consumption, operating trajectory, signal strength, action/screen detection, body temperature, body weight, and on/off status), as well as the operating conditions of device consumables (such as the filter, filter service life, etc.) allow you to remotely view the status of your device so you can see how well it is running in your home at any time.
• Setting up automated tasks. Event information reported by your device (such as temperature, humidity, PM2.5, AQI, TDS, tVOC, CO2, ambient light, smoke concentration, natural gas concentration, power consumption, operating trajectory, signal strength, and action/screen detection) can be used to create your own personal automated tasks, such as accessing Mi Home’s temperature sensor when the temperature is higher than 30℃ to access control of Mi Home’s smart air conditioner to start cooling.
• Providing push services. The account and IMEI number will also be used to provide Mi Home push services to send notifications to users. You can turn this feature off at any time by changing your preferences under Message Settings.
• Verifying user identity. Mi Home uses ECV values to verify user identities and ensure that hackers or unauthorized persons cannot log in.
• Collecting user feedback. The feedback you choose to provide is extremely valuable to helping Mi Home improve our services. In order to follow the feedback you choose to provide, Mi Home may use the personal information you provide to contact you and to keep records.
• Sending notifications. From time to time we may use your personal information to send important notices, such as unexpected device health notifications, customized device push notifications (such as motion detection alerts, cleanups, etc.), or changes to our terms and conditions or policies.
• Direct marketing. We may use your name, phone number, email address, Mi and Mi Home accounts, and IMEI numbers to provide you with promotional materials for products and services from Xiaomi and our partners (providing web, mobile applications, and cloud products and services). To provide a better user experience, we recommend these products, services, and events based on your purchase history, site browsing history, birthday, age, gender, and location. We strictly adhere to the data protection laws of your location and require independent, express permission, so we will only use your personal information with your consent or your lack of objection. You have the right to terminate our use of personal data intended for direct marketing. If you no longer wish to receive certain categories of e-mail, you can unsubscribe using the unsubscribe link at the bottom of each e-mail. We will not send your personal information to our business partners for direct marketing.

With whom do we share your information?
We will not sell your personal information to a third party.
From time to time, we may disclose your personal information to third parties (as defined below) to provide the products or services you request. We may disclose information to third-party service providers and affiliates listed below in this section. In the circumstances described in this section, you can rest assured that Xiaomi will only share your personal information based on your authorization. You understand that Xiaomi will comply with applicable local data protection laws through contractual third-party practices and obligations when Xiaomi shares your personal information with third-party service providers under any of the circumstances described below. Xiaomi will contract to ensure that third-party service providers comply with the privacy standards applicable to them in your jurisdiction.

Sharing information within our group and with third party service providers
In order to successfully conduct business and provide you with the full functionality of our products and services, we may from time to time disclose your personal information to other Xiaomi affiliates (dealing with communications, social media, technology or cloud businesses) or our third party service providers (our mailing houses, delivery service providers, telecommunications companies, data centers, data storage facilities, customer service providers, advertising and promotion service providers, and agents representing Xiaomi) [Affiliates and/or other third parties] (collectively third party service providers). Such third party service providers may handle your personal information on behalf of Xiaomi or for one or more of the above items. When using certain mobile applications on our devices, we may share your IP address with third parties in order to provide you with certain services you request. If you no longer wish to allow us to share this information, please contact us at privacy@xiaomi.com.

Sharing information with the Xiaomi Ecosystem Company
Xiaomi works together with a group of other cool companies to form the Mi Ecosystem. A Mi Ecosystem company is an independent entity invested and operated by Xiaomi and is an expert in these fields. Xiaomi may disclose your personal information to a Mi Ecosystem company in order to provide and improve exciting products and services (including software and hardware) from the Mi Ecosystem. Some products and services still use the Xiaomi/Mi Home brands, but others may use their own brands. From time to time, the Mi Ecosystem may share data related to Xiaomi/Mi Home brand products and services in order to provide software and hardware services for better functionality and user experience. If Xiaomi is involved in the acquisition, merger, acquisition or disposal of all or any part of its assets, we will notify by email and/or prominently on our website of any changes to the ownership of your personal information or its use, as well as any options you may have regarding your personal information.

Sharing information with others
Mi Home may disclose your personal information without further consent, as required by applicable law.

Information that does not require consent
• We may share anonymous information with third parties (such as advertisers on our website) in an aggregated form for commercial purposes; we may share general usage trends for our services, such as the number of customers in certain groups who buy certain products or engage in certain transactions.
• In order to avoid doubt, Xiaomi may collect, use or disclose your personal information, without your consent, in the circumstances and to the extent expressly permitted by the Law on Local Data Protection (for example, in order to comply with a summons), and we may disclose your information without your consent, in good faith, for the purposes of protecting our rights, protecting your safety or the safety of others, and disclosing for investigation of fraud or responding to governmental requests.

Security
Xiaomi’s security measures
We promise to keep your personal information safe. To prevent unauthorized access, disclosure or other similar risks, we have put in place reasonable physical, electronic, and management processes to protect the information we collect from your mobile device. We will take all reasonable steps to protect your personal information.

For example, when you visit your Mi Account, you can choose our two-step verification process to ensure better security. When you send or receive information from Mi Home devices to our servers, we ensure that they are encrypted using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and other algorithms.

All of your personal information is stored on secure servers and protected in controlled facilities. We classify your data by importance and sensitivity and ensure that your personal information has the highest level of security. We guarantee that employees and third-party service providers who provide your products and services to you by accessing this information will have strict contractual confidentiality obligations and will be subject to disciplinary action or termination of cooperation if they fail to meet these obligations. In addition, we have specialized access controls for cloud-based data storage. All in all, we regularly review the practice of collecting, storing and processing information, including physical security measures to prevent any unauthorized access and use.

We will take all practicable steps to protect your personal information. However, you should be aware that the use of the internet is not always safe and therefore we cannot guarantee the security or completeness of any personal information as it travels bidirectionally over the Internet.

What you can do:
• You can help protect the security of your personal information by not disclosing your login password or account information to anyone (unless they have been duly authorized by you). Whenever you log into Mi Home as the user of your Mi Account, you should always log out when the session ends, especially when you log in on someone else's computer or a public Internet terminal.
• Xiaomi cannot be responsible for any security breach caused by third parties accessing your personal information due to your inability to maintain the confidentiality of your personal information. Notwithstanding the above, you must notify us immediately in the event of the unauthorized use of your account by any other user of the internet, or any other security breach.
• Your assistance will help us protect the privacy of your personal information.

Retention policies
We will retain your personal information for the purpose of collecting information if necessary, or to comply with applicable legal requirements or allowances.
